resources.string: Please refine the location of any reports with this icon

Thank you for participating!

Roadkill Reporter is a mobile app that allows you to participate in a parasitology project exploring the genetics and distribution of the raccoon roundworm, an intestinal parasite infecting 60–80% of raccoons in the Midwest. Specimens for this project come primarily from road–killed raccoons, and this app allows you to pinpoint and report the location of a roadkill. The principal investigators of this project will see the location of your entry on a map, and be able to retrieve the specimen for analysis.

Things to consider
• Please do NOT use this app while driving! Please pull over before reporting.
• You will have the option later of refining the location of the roadkill you saw.
• Don’t touch the roadkill! That’s our job.
• Raccoons only please.
• Your participation is completely anonymous
• This project is based on samples obtained from West Michigan only, so reports out of that location will not be monitored.

Credits
Developer: Caleb Gomer
Artwork: Jen Gagne
Advisors:
• Doug Graham, Biomedical Sciences
• Greg Wolffe, Computer Science
Tab Icons: www.icons8.com
